solution.text:
Using Pythagoras Theorem we can write following relations
In \(\Delta\)ABC - \(AB^2 + BC^2 = AC^2\) ----(1)
In \(\Delta\)ABD - \(AD^2 + BD^2 = AB^2\) ----(2)
In \(\Delta\)CBD - \(CD^2 + BD^2 = BC^2\) ----(3)
In \(\Delta\)AED - \(AE^2 + ED^2 = AD^2\) ----(4)
In \(\Delta\)CFD - \(CF^2 + FD^2 = CD^2\) ----(5)
In \(\Delta\)BED - \(BE^2 + ED^2 = BD^2\) ----(6)
In \(\Delta\)BFD - \(BF^2 + FD^2 = BD^2\) ----(7)
Subtract eq(3) from eq(2)
We get, \(AD^2 + BD^2 - CD^2 - BD^2 = AB^2 - BC^2\)
We get, \(AD^2 - CD^2 = AB^2 - BC^2\) ----(8)
Now, Subtract eq(5) from eq(4)
\(AE^2 + ED^2 - CF^2 - FD^2 = AD^2 - CD^2\)
\(AE^2 - CF^2 + ED^2 - FD^2 = AD^2 - CD^2\) ----(9)
Subtract eq(7) from eq(6)
\(BE^2 + ED^2 - BF^2 - FD^2= BD^2 - BD^2\)
\(BE^2 + ED^2 - BF^2 - FD^2= 0\)
\(ED^2 - FD^2 = BF^2 - BE^2\) ----(10)
Subtract eq(10) from eq(9)
We get,
\(AE^2 - CF^2 = AD^2 - CD^2 - BF^2 + BE^2\) ----(11)
\(AE^2 - CF^2 + BF^2 - BE^2 = AD^2 - CD^2 \) ----(11)
Now, Add eq(8) and eq(11)
\(AE^2 - CF^2 + BF^2 - BE^2 = AB^2 - BC^2 \)
Now, rearrange the above equation
\(BC^2 + AE^2 + BF^2 = AB^2 + CF^2 + BE^2\)
Comparing with given equation, we get,
\(X\) = \(CF^2\)
